Definition:
Write an incorrect answer to the given question based on the associated fact. You are also provided with the correct answer to the given question. Make sure that your incorrect answer is relevant and similar to the associated fact.  Also try to make the incorrect answer similar to the correct answer so that distinguishing correct answer from the incorrect answer is not very easy.
Things to avoid: Make sure you don't accidentally provide another correct answer! Also make sure they sound reasonable (e.g., might be on a school pop quiz).
Emphasis & Caution: A good incorrect answer can be constructed using words associated with the question, but not the correct answer. For example, for the question "What helps plants survive?", using words like "weeds", "vase", "bee" (associated with "plant"), or "first aid", "parachute", "accident" (associated with "survive") etc. in your incorrect answers makes the question hard, so these results in good incorect answers.
